tit.cmt: 他の「建造物」ファイルに合せて訂正しました。

sen.j: 龍角寺岩屋古墳（りゅうかくじいわやこふん）は、千葉県印旛郡栄町にある方墳。
sen.e: Ryukakuji Iwaya Kofun (龍角寺岩屋古墳) is a hofun (方墳, a square tumulus) in Sakae-cho, Inba-gun, Chiba Prefecture.
Ryukakuji Iwaya Tumulus is a square tumulus in Sakae-cho, Inba-gun, Chiba Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 漢字の表記を削除しました。Tumulusに訂正しました。
sen.e: Ryukakuji Iwaya Tumulus is a square tumulus in Sakae-cho, Inba-gun, Chiba Prefecture.

sen.j: 115基ある竜角寺古墳群の105号古墳である。
sen.e: It is the 105th tumulus of the 115 Ryukakuji burial mounds.
It is the 105th tumulus of the 115 Ryukakuji burial mounds.
It is the 105th tumulus of the 115 Ryukakuji burial mounds.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 印旛沼北岸の標高約30メートルの台地上に位置する。
sen.e: Ryukakuji Iwaya Kofun is located on the plateau about 30 meters above sea level on the northern shore of Inba-numa Marsh.
Ryukakuji Iwaya Tumulus is located on the plateau about 30 meters above sea level on the northern shore of Inba-numa Marsh.
Ryukakuji Iwaya Tumulus is located on the plateau about 30 meters above sea level on the northern shore of Inba-numa Marsh.

sen.j: 築造年代は古墳時代終末期の7世紀末頃と考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that this tumulus was constructed around the end of the seventh century in the Final Kofun period.
It is thought that this tumulus was constructed around the end of the seventh century in the Final Tumulus period.
It is thought that this tumulus was constructed around the end of the seventh century in the Final Tumulus period.

sen.j: 一辺78メートル、墳丘は3段築成。
sen.e: Each side of it is 78 meters long, and the mound is constructed from the three-step terraced slope.
Each side of it is 78 meters long, and the mound is constructed from the three-step terraced slope.
Each side of it is 78 meters long, and the mound is constructed from the three-step terraced slope.

sen.j: 高さは13.2メートル、幅3メートルの周溝と周堤が巡っている。
sen.e: It is 13.2 meters high and is surrounded by the moats of 3 meters breadth and the embankments.
It is 13.2 meters high and is surrounded by the moats of 3 meters breadth and the embankments.
It is 13.2 meters high and is surrounded by the moats of 3 meters breadth and the embankments.

sen.j: 同時期の大方墳である春日向山古墳（用明天皇陵）、山田高塚古墳（推古天皇陵）をもしのぐ規模であり、この時期の方墳としては全国最大級の規模である。
sen.e: The size of this tumulus surpasses even those of Kasuga Mukaiyama Kofun (the burial mound of Emperor Yomei) and Yamada Takatsuka Kofun (the burial mound of Empress Suiko) which were huge square tumuli in the same period, and as a square tumulus of this period, it is the largest in scale in all over Japan.

The size of this tumulus surpasses even those of Kasuga Mukaiyama Tumulus (the burial mound of Emperor Yomei) and Yamada Takatsuka Tumulus (the burial mound of Empress Suiko) which were huge square tumuli in the same period, and as a square tumulus of this period, it is the largest in scale in all over Japan.

The size of this tumulus surpasses even those of Kasuga Mukaiyama Tumulus (the burial mound of Emperor Yomei) and Yamada Takatsuka Tumulus (the burial mound of Empress Suiko) which were huge square tumuli in the same period, and as a square tumulus of this period, it is the largest in scale in all over Japan.

sen.j: 南面には2基の横穴式石室が10メートル間隔で並ぶ。
sen.e: On the southern side, there are two horizontal stone chambers side by side with an interval of 10 meters.
On the southern side, there are two horizontal stone chambers side by side with an interval of 10 meters.
On the southern side, there are two horizontal stone chambers side by side with an interval of 10 meters.

sen.j: 西側石室は奥行4.23メートル、奥壁幅1.68メートル、高さ2.14メートルを測る。
sen.e: The western stone chamber measures 4.23 meters in depth, 1.68 meters in width of the inner back wall, and 2.14 meters in height.
The western stone chamber measures 4.23 meters in depth, 1.68 meters in width of the inner back wall, and 2.14 meters in height.
The western stone chamber measures 4.23 meters in depth, 1.68 meters in width of the inner back wall, and 2.14 meters in height.

sen.j: 東側の石室は西側よりやや大きいが、現在は崩落している。
sen.e: The eastern stone chamber is a little bigger than the western one, but at present it has collapsed.
The eastern stone chamber is a little bigger than the western one, but at present it has collapsed.
The eastern stone chamber is a little bigger than the western one, but at present it has collapsed.

sen.j: 石材は凝灰岩砂岩で、この地方で産出される貝の化石を多量に含んだものである。
sen.e: The building stone is tuffaceus sandstone, which contains a lot of fossils of shells that are produced in this region.
The building stone is tuffaceus sandstone, which contains a lot of fossils of shells that are produced in this region.
The building stone is tuffaceus sandstone, which contains a lot of fossils of shells that are produced in this region.

sen.j: 被葬者は不明。
sen.e: It is unknown who was buried there.
It is unknown who was buried there.
It is unknown who was buried there.

sen.j: 1970年（昭和45年）に墳丘と横穴式石室の測量調査が行われている。
sen.e: In 1970, the mound and the horizontal stone chambers were surveyed.
In 1970, the mound and the horizontal stone chambers were surveyed.
In 1970, the mound and the horizontal stone chambers were surveyed.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History of Survey
History of Survey
History of Survey

sen.j: 1970年（昭和45年） 明治大学による、石室の実測、墳丘の地形測量。
sen.e: In1970, the stone chambers were measured and the topography of the mound was surveyed by Meiji University.
In 1970, the stone chambers were measured and the topography of the mound was surveyed by Meiji University.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。
sen.e: In 1970, the stone chambers were measured and the topography of the mound was surveyed by Meiji University.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年） 栄町教育委員会による104号古墳を含む清掃地形測量。
sen.e: In 2007, the cleaning topography containing the 104th tumulus was surveyed by Sakae Town Board of Education.
In 2007, the cleaning topography containing the 104th tumulus was surveyed by Sakae Town Board of Education.
In 2007, the cleaning topography containing the 104th tumulus was surveyed by Sakae Town Board of Education.

sen.j: 史跡指定
sen.e: Designation as Historic Site
Designation as Historic Site
Designation as Historic Site

sen.j: 1941年（昭和16年）1月27日、国の史跡に指定された。
sen.e: On January 27, 1941, it was designated as a national historic site.
On January 27, 1941, it was designated as a national historic site.
On January 27, 1941, it was designated as a national historic site.

sen.j: 管理団体は龍角寺である。
sen.e: The management organization is Ryukaku-ji Temple.
The management organization is Ryukaku-ji Temple.
The management organization is Ryukaku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 住所
sen.e: Address
Address
Address

sen.j: 千葉県印旛郡栄町龍角寺字池下1601他
sen.e: Ryukakuji Aza Ikeshita 1601 and the others, Sakae-cho, Inba-gun, Chiba Prefecture.
Ryukakuji Aza Ikeshita 1601 and the others, Sakae-cho, Inba-gun, Chiba Prefecture.
Ryukakuji Aza Ikeshita 1601 and the others, Sakae-cho, Inba-gun, Chiba Prefecture.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 岩屋古墳の住所は龍角寺と書くが、古墳群の名称は通常「竜」の字を用いている。
sen.e: Ryukakuji is written as 龍角寺 in the address of Iwaya Kofun, but in the name of the burial mounds, a Chinese character "竜"is usually used instead of "龍".
Ryukakuji is written as (龍角寺) in the address of Iwaya Kofun, but in the name of the burial mounds, a Chinese character (竜) is usually used instead of (龍).
sen.cmt: ()を補足、または訂正しました。
sen.e: Ryukakuji is written as (龍角寺) in the address of Iwaya Kofun, but in the name of the burial mounds, a Chinese character (竜) is usually used instead of (龍).

sen.j: また、近隣にある龍角寺という寺は「龍」の字である。
sen.e: Besides, in the name of Ryukaku-ji Temple near this tumulus, a Chinese character "龍" is used.
Besides, in the name of Ryukaku-ji Temple near this tumulus, a Chinese character (龍) is used.
Besides, in the name of Ryukaku-ji Temple near this tumulus, a Chinese character (龍) is used.

sen.j: 古墳の頂上に三角点が位置する。
sen.e: On the top of the mound of this tumulus, a triangulation point is placed.
On the top of the mound of this tumulus, a triangulation point is placed.
On the top of the mound of this tumulus, a triangulation point is placed.
